revised_title: Anatomy of Tympanum and Palate Communications in Crocodilian Reptiles
tldr: Richard Owen's study on the communications between the tympanum and palate in crocodilian reptiles reveals a distinct system of Eustachian canals, which are unique to this group of reptiles. The research also clarifies the position of the carotid foramina and posterior nostrils in Teleosauri and other extinct crocodilians.
